intro: Atropis conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlet, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
